gurmukhi: jyst puqR DrI Drw iqh BrQ nwm bKwn ] BrQ KMf bKwn hI ds cwr cwr indwn ]53]
transliteration: Jesat Poutra Dharidharaa Tih Bharath Naam Bakhaan|| Bharth Khanndbakhaan Hidas Chaar Chaar Nidaan||53||
translation: The eldest son, whose name was Bharat, he named one of the region as “Bharat Khand”, after the name of the adept Bharat, who was expert in eighteen sciences.53.

gurmukhi: kaun kaun khY kbY kiv nwm Twm AnMq ] bwit bwit sBo ley nvKMf dIp durMq ]
transliteration: Kaoun Kaoun Kahai Kabai Kavi Naam Thaam Anant|| Baat Baattee Sabho Lae Navkhannddeep Durant||
translation: Which names should be mentioned here by the poet ?; they all distributed the Nav-Khand continents among themselves;

gurmukhi: Twm Twm Bey nrwiDp Twm nwm Anyk ] kaun kaun aucwrIAY kir sUr srb ibbyk ]54]
transliteration: Thaam Thaam Bhae Naraadhip Thaam Naam Anek|| Kaoun Kaoun Oucdareeaikar(i) Soor Sarab Bibek||54||
translation: Many of various names ruled over many places and with power of intellect, whose names should be mentioned, with their description? 54.

gurmukhi: spq dIpn spq BUp BugY lgY nvKMf ] BwNq BwNqn so iPry Ais bwND joD pRcMf ]
transliteration: Sapat Deepan Sapat Bhoop Bhougad Lagad Navkhand|| Bhaant Bhaantan So Phire As(i) Baandh Jodh Prachanndd||
translation: The king ruled over seven continents and nine regions and taking up their swords, in various ways, they moved at all places powerfully;

gurmukhi: dIh dIh AjIh dysin nwm Awip Bnwie ] Awin jwn duqI Bey iCq dUsry hirrwie ]55]
transliteration: Deeh Deeh Ajih Desan(i) Naam Aap(i) Bhanaae|| Aan(i) Jaan Douti Bhae Chhit Doosre Har(i)raae||55||
translation: They forcefully promulgated their names and it seemed that they were the incarnation of the Lord on the earth.55.

gurmukhi: Awp Awps mY sBY isr AqR pqR iPrwie ] jIq jIq AjIq joDn roh kRoh kmwie ]
transliteration: Aap Apas Mai Sobhai Sir Atra Patra Phiraae|| Jeet Jeet Ajeet Jodhan Roh Kroh Kamaae||
translation: They continued to conquer furiously the invincible warriors, swinging the canopies over the heads of one another;

gurmukhi: JUT swc AnMq bol klol kyl Anyk ] AMqkwl sBY BCY jg CwfIAw nih eyk ]56]
transliteration: Jhooth Saach Anant Bol Kalol Kel Anek|| Antkaal Sabhai Bachhai Jag Chhaadeeaa Nah(i) Ek||56||
translation: Garrying on behavior conquer furiously the invincible warriors, Swinging the canopies over the ultimately became the food of KAL ( death).56.

gurmukhi: Awp ArQ AnrQ AprQ smrQ krq AnMq ] AMq hoq TtI kCU pRB kot kXoN n krMq ]
transliteration: Aap Arth Anarth Aparth Samarth Karat Anant|| Ant Hot Thati Kachhodh Prabh Kot Kyon Na Karant||
translation: The powerful people perform many sinful action and unjust deeds, for their interest, but ultimately they have to appear before the Lord;

gurmukhi: jwn bUJ prMq kUp lhMq mUV n Byv ] AMq kwl qbY bcY jb jwn hY gurdyv ]57]
transliteration: Jaan Boodhe Parant Koop Lahant Moond Na Bhev|| Ant Kaal Tabai Bachai Jab Jaan Hai Gurdev||57||
translation: The being deliberately falls into the well and dose not know the secret of the Lord; he will only save himself from death, when he will comprehend that Guru-Lord.57.

gurmukhi: AMq hoq TtI BlI pRB mUV logn jwn ] Awp ArQ pCwn hI qj dIh dyv inDwn ]
transliteration: Ant Hot Thatibhaliprabh Moond Logad Jaan|| Aap Arth Pachhaad Hitaj Deeh Dev Nidhaan||
translation: The fools do not know that ultimately we feet shy before the Lord; these fools forsaking their supreme father, the Lord, only recognize their own interest;

gurmukhi: Drm jwn krMq pwpn XO n jwnq mUV ] srb kwl dieAwl ko kh pRXog gUV AgUV ]58]
transliteration: Dharam Jaan Karant Paapanyau Na Jaanat Moond|| Sarab Kaal Daiaal Ko Kah Prayog Good Agood||58||
translation: They commit sins in the name of religion and they do not know even this much that this is the profound myself of the compassionate of the Name of the Lord.58;

gurmukhi: pwp puMn pCwn hI kir puMn kI sm pwp ] prm jwn pivqR jwpn jpY lwg kujwp ]
transliteration: Paap Pounn Pachhaad Hikar Aap Pounn Kisam Paap|| Param Jaan Pavitra Jaapan Japai Laag Kujaap||
translation: They are ever absorbed in evil action considering sin as virtue and virtue as sin, the holy as unholy and without knowing the remembrance of the Name of the Lord:

gurmukhi: is`D Taur n mwnhI ibn is`D Taur pUjMq ] hwQ dIpku lY mhw psu miD kUp prMq ]59]
transliteration: Siddh Thaur Na Maan-hibin Siddh Thaur Poojant|| Haath Deepak(u) Lai Mahaa Pas(u) Madh(i) Koop Parant||59||
translation: The being does not believe in the good place and worship bad place; in such a position he falls in the well, even having the lamp in his hand.59.

gurmukhi: is`D Taur n mwnhI Anis`D pUjq Taur ] kYk idvs clwh jy jV BIq kI sI daur ]
transliteration: Siddh Thaur Na Maan-hiansiddh Poojat Thaur|| Kiak Divas Chalaah Je Jaad Bhit Ki Si Daur||
translation: Having on belief in holy places, he worship the unholy ones; but for now many days he will be able to run such a cowardly race ?
